title: D-Link DAP-2622 DDP Configuration Backup Auth Password Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of D-Link DAP-2622 routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the DDP service. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root.
addtionnal_details: D-Link has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://supportannouncement.us.dlink.com/announcement/publication.aspx?name=SAP10349
timeline:
2023-01-20 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2023-08-25 - Coordinated public release of advisory
credit: Dmitry "InfoSecDJ" Janushkevich of Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative
